title: National Physical Fitness and Sports Month, 2025
summary:
The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump declaring May 2025 as National Physical Fitness and Sports Month. It emphasizes the importance of physical fitness and sports in promoting healthier lifestyles and improving public health outcomes in the United States, which currently lags behind other developed nations in these areas. 

The proclamation outlines the administration's commitment to enhancing public health, including the appointment of Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. as Secretary of Health and Human Services and the establishment of the Make America Healthy Again Commission. It highlights initiatives aimed at increasing children's participation in sports and ensuring fair competition for female athletes by keeping biological men out of women's sports.

The President calls on Americans to incorporate physical fitness and sports into their daily routines to foster a healthier nation, empowering citizens to reach their full potential. The overarching message is one of promoting health and well-being through active engagement in sports and fitness.
